Vijay’s TVK slams Shah for Hindi 'imposition'; terms it against federalism
description: Actor Vijay's Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) has strongly condemned Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks promoting Hindi, viewing it as an imposition that undermines federalism. The party argues that prioritizing Hindi in government administration disregards the nation's linguistic diversity and goes against the spirit of inclusivity. TVK urges Shah to retract his statement emphasizing Hindi's role in a self-reliant India.

'Go beyond traditional war concept': Rajnath to forces; flags 'unconventional threats'
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, addressing the Combined Commanders’ Conference 2025, urged the Armed Forces to prepare for modern warfare, including information and biological threats. He emphasized technology adoption and self-reliance, calling for a 'Sudarshan Chakra' strategy. Singh highlighted the 'JAI' mantra (Jointness, Aatmanirbharta, Innovation) for military modernization and cited Operation Sindoor as an example of India's growing indigenous capabilities.

title: Rs 579.06 crore! Apollo Tyre to sponsor Indian team; outbid Canva, JK Cement
description: Apollo Tyres has secured the Indian cricket team's jersey sponsorship until 2027, committing approximately Rs 4.5 crores per game, surpassing Dream11's previous rate. The deal encompasses around 130 fixtures. Canva and JK Cement were also in contention, while Birla Optus Paints showed interest but avoided bidding. Dream11's exit was triggered by the government's online gaming regulations.

title: Asia Cup row: BJP targets Rahul over Afridi's remarks; Cong hits back with old pic
description: The Asia Cup handshake controversy escalated after India skipped the customary exchange with Pakistan, drawing political reactions. Shahid Afridi criticised PM Modi, praising Rahul Gandhi, while BJP's Amit Malviya questioned Gandhi's loyalties. The PCB filed a complaint with the ICC, alleging misconduct by the match referee, and threatened withdrawal from the Asia Cup 2025.

Haryanvi actor and filmmaker Uttar Kumar arrested in alleged rape case
description: Uttar Kumar, a Haryanvi actor and filmmaker, is in police custody. A 25-year-old colleague accused him of r*pe and intimidation. The woman attempted suicide outside the Chief Minister's residence in Lucknow. She alleged inaction by authorities. The complainant stated harassment began in 2020. She filed a complaint, but alleges police mishandled the case.

title: Exclusive: R Ashwin poised for ILT20 stint with possible player-coach role
description: Ravichandran Ashwin may soon be seen in the ILT20 League. ILT20 CEO David White has expressed strong interest in having Ashwin play. White highlighted Ashwin's exceptional talent and cricket intellect. Ashwin has retired from the IPL and is keen to explore opportunities in other leagues. He is also open to coaching roles. Ashwin has registered for overseas leagues.

description: Beginning in 2026, the CBSE will accommodate student-athletes under the new two-board-exam system for Class 10. The sports exam accommodation aligns with the second board exam in May, addressing date clashes between sporting events and academic assessments. This provision ensures students can manage both sports and studies effectively, with re-exams available if needed.

title: Once the fastest! Usian Bolt now struggles on stairs, says 'not a fan' of running now
description: Usain Bolt, the retired sprinting icon, made a rare appearance in Tokyo, recreating his signature pose. He now enjoys a relaxed life with family, movies, and Lego, while still holding world records. Bolt believes his generation was faster, emphasizing the importance of natural talent over technology, and encourages current athletes to be authentic with fans.

title: UAE Lottery: How to play and win up to Dh60,000
description: The UAE Lottery has launched Colour Prediction, a fast-paced online game with draws every minute and prizes up to Dh60,000. Players can pick numbers or colours starting at Dh1. This follows July’s launch of Gemstone Riches and Sports Mania. The platform is regulated, promotes responsible play, and is open only to players aged 18 and above.

Nasa’s Guardian detects tsunami: 30-minute early warning; a space-based breakthrough
description: In July 2025, NASA's Guardian system detected a tsunami triggered by a massive earthquake near Kamchatka. Utilizing atmospheric disturbances and GNSS signals, Guardian issued alerts up to 30 minutes before landfall. This experimental technology enhances traditional warning systems, offering near-real-time, global monitoring and marking a significant advancement in disaster preparedness.

There's also a disparity in media attention given to different incidents of political violence.

Her death, attributed to fatal health complications leading to brain death, has prompted tributes from fans and fellow creators.

From ice cream to hamburgers: Words Kim Jong Un has banned
description: Kim Jong Un's government in North Korea has banned the term 'ice cream'. The government replaced it with state-approved terms. This is part of a campaign to remove foreign words. Tourism guides are trained to avoid Anglicised words. 'Hamburger' is now 'double bread with ground beef'. The policy aims to strengthen North Korean expressions. It also eliminates outside cultural influence.

title: 'No confusion': Tejashwi says CM face to be named at 'right time'; cites 'people's mandate'
description: Tejashwi Yadav, amidst his 'Bihar Adhikar Yatra,' asserted the Mahagathbandhan alliance faces no confusion regarding its chief ministerial candidate for the upcoming Bihar assembly election. He emphasized that the people of Bihar desire change and will ultimately decide who leads the state.

title: Coimbatore airport’s new integrated terminal building to be four times bigger
description: Tamil Nadu government has handed over 605 acres of land out of the 627 acres requested by AAI for the airport expansion project, said the airport’s Director

description: When the women tried to catch him, the accused allegedly manhandled the duo, pushed them on the ground and tried to flee from the mall

Kerala: 2 government employees among 14 accused of raping boy; 9 arrested
description: In Kerala's Kasaragod, a disturbing case has emerged involving the sexual assault of a 16-year-old boy. Nine individuals, including two government employees, have been arrested. The victim was allegedly abused over two years by 14 men he met on a gay dating app, with incidents occurring at his home and in Kannur and Kozhikode.

description: In a statement, NSUI alleged that the members of the ABVP, the student wing of the RSS, attacked its Purvanchal student supporters in a bid to disrupt the programme.

description: Zoom CEO Eric Yuan joins other tech leaders in predicting AI will revolutionize productivity, potentially leading to a three-day workweek. Yuan emphasizes that AI's rapid evolution will enable people to achieve the same results with less effort, echoing sentiments shared by Bill Gates and Jensen Huang.

description: ITR filing FY 2024-25 due day extension: Taxpayers are reportedly facing persistent technical issues on the Income Tax e-filing portal even after the Finance Ministry extended the ITR filing deadline to September 16, 2025. Despite scheduled maintenance, users reported problems with submission, late fee reflections, and portal functionality.

Wearing a headset and conferring with the offensive staff, including Chip Kelly, Brady's involvement raised questions about fairness and potential rule violations, especially given his part-ownership of the team and upcoming broadcasting role covering other NFL teams.

Pak PM likely to meet Trump; talks expected on UNGA sidelines - Report
description: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Army Chief Asim Munir, recently promoted to Field Marshal, are reportedly meeting with US President Donald Trump on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly. This follows a prior White House luncheon between Trump and Munir, where discussions included the Iran-Israel conflict and potential US-Pakistan trade partnerships.

Mother Dairy price cut: Revised rates effective from Sept 22
description: Mother Dairy will reduce prices on most value-added dairy and processed food products starting September 22, 2025, passing on 100% of the GST benefits to consumers. This decision follows the GST Council's rationalization of tax slabs, aiming to boost consumption and make packaged foods more affordable.

title: Fraud case: Raj Kundra questioned for 5 hours; what businessman said
description: Raj Kundra, husband of Shilpa Shetty, is under investigation for a Rs 60 crore fraud. He told Mumbai Police that Bipasha Basu and Neha Dhupia received fees from the disputed amount. Investigators found fund transfers to several actresses, including Shilpa Shetty. Suspicious transactions occurred during demonetisation. Police plan to re-examine 'Best Deal' videos.

description: Mohammad Yousuf, the former Pakistani batter, sparked controversy by using disrespectful language towards India's Suryakumar Yadav during a panel discussion. He also accused the Indian cricket board of exerting undue influence, citing the Asia Cup handshake incident. The ICC rejected PCB's demand to remove the match referee, further fuelling the tensions after India's victory.

Saudi Arabia’s central bank launches Google Pay and announces Alipay+ acceptance by 2026
description: Google Pay has officially launched in Saudi Arabia via the national Mada network, enabling secure digital transactions. SAMA also announced Alipay+ acceptance by 2026, enhancing cross-border payments. These moves align with Vision 2030 goals to boost financial inclusion and reduce cash use. Saudi’s fintech sector has surged, attracting $2.39 billion in investments and achieving 79% electronic retail payments.

description: Jaish-e-Mohammad commander Masood Ilyas Kashmiri admitted in a video that India's Operation Sindoor severely impacted Maulana Masood Azhar's family. The strike on May 7 targeted terror infrastructure in Bahawalpur, JeM's headquarters, following the deadly Pahalgam attack where 26 civilians were killed. India retaliated by destroying major terror hubs and air infrastructure across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

Who is Nupur Bora? Assam officer accused of illegal transfer of Hindus’ land
description: Assam Civil Service officer Nupur Bora has been arrested in connection with a corruption scandal involving illegal land transfers and disproportionate assets. Raids on her residences in Guwahati uncovered nearly Rs 1 crore in cash, diamonds, and jewellery. The investigation was triggered by complaints of unexplained wealth and questionable land transactions, particularly in Barpeta district.

title: Israel begins ground offensive to occupy Gaza City amid escalation in bombardment
'Our board can't afford': Pakistan unlikely to withdraw from Asia Cup
description: ​​The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is unlikely to withdraw from the Asia Cup 2025, despite rising tensions over the role of match referee Andy Pycroft during Pakistan’s match against India in Dubai on Sunday. Match referee Pycroft had asked Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha and Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav to skip the customary handshake at the toss.

India’s 1st private strategic oil reserve! Rs 5,700cr project in works; why it’s important
description: Megha Engineering has secured a Rs 5,700 crore contract to build and manage India's first private strategic petroleum reserve in Padur, Karnataka. This 2.5 MMT facility will significantly boost India's energy security, supplementing the existing reserves.

description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned former cricketers Robin Uthappa and Yuvraj Singh, along with actor Sonu Sood, for questioning in a money laundering case related to the alleged illegal online betting app 1xBet. They are scheduled to appear next week under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

'Interest-free for all': Nitish Kumar on student credit card loans; what it means for Bihar
description: The Bihar government has announced that education loans under the Student Credit Card (SCC) scheme will now be interest-free for all students. Chief Minister Nitish Kumar also revealed an extension in the repayment period, from five to seven years for loans up to Rs 2 lakh, and up to ten years for larger loans. The move aims to ease financial stress and promote higher education access across the state.

Roads blocked, vehicles swept away: Cloudburst in Himachal, Uttarakhand
description: Heavy rain, cloudbursts, and landslides have caused widespread destruction in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand. In Himachal Pradesh, three people died in Mandi district due to a landslide. Uttarakhand was hit by a cloudburst in Dehradun, damaging properties and infrastructure. Rescue operations are underway, and authorities are providing assistance to those affected, with the Chief Ministers monitoring the situation.

title: Google’s Nano Banana AI: Saree edits take over Instagram; 5 mistakes to avoid
description: The internet is abuzz with the Google Gemini Nano Banana AI saree trend, enabling users to transform selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits. These viral edits feature chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, achieved through precise AI prompts.

description: Following the brutal beheading of Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah in Dallas, DHS issued a warning about the risks posed by criminal illegal immigrants. Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, a Cuban national, allegedly committed the crime after being released into the US. President Trump condemned the killing, criticizing the Biden administration's immigration policies and vowing strict action against criminal illegal immigrants.

title: BMW crash: FIR contradicts DCP's statement, claims counsel
description: In the Delhi BMW accident case near Dhaula Kuan, the accused's lawyer, Vikas Pahwa, claims the FIR contradicts the DCP's statement. Gaganpreet Kaur, the driver, is in judicial custody after the accident resulted in one death and one injury.

title: Road rage kidnapping: Puja Khedkar's dad was in SUV; mother unleashed dogs to scare cops
Raid on Assam civil servant tied to ‘illegal transfer of Hindus’ land’
description: Assam bureaucrat Nupur Bora, a 2019-batch ACS officer, has been arrested for alleged corruption involving illegal land transfers in Barpeta, where the government is targeting suspected Bangladeshi settlers. Raids on her properties revealed nearly ₹1 crore in cash and valuable jewelry. CM Sarma stated that Bora was under investigation for transferring land to a specific community and hoarding disproportionate assets.
